titleStmt.title: Martin Jones to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5419

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To his excellency Thomas E. Bramlett Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky your petitioner Martin Jones states that at the presant term of the Laurel Circuit Court he was fined in the sum of twenty Dollars on an indictment for gameing Your petitioner states that he is no gambler, but happened to engage in a little game for amusement (where there was merely a treat but) at Mr Gibson,s store in Laurel County-

and he was indicted & fined as above stated, he is a poor man who makes this support of himself and family by honest labour & he therefore prays that your excellency may remit said fine all except the cost
We the undersigned are acquainted with petitioner Martin Jones & state that he is a sober industrious harmless man & we pray to be heard in his behalf that your excellency may remit said fine

David M. Lyttle
We concur in the prayer of the foregoing petition

R. Herndon
R. P. Young
L. A. Byron
Laurel Cir Ct
Martin Jones
Petition
